page.title: 16Employment
page.content: These are the reults of asurvey Carried out by Penarlag C.P.. Of 91 returns: 12 people were unemployed(6 for longer than 4 years) .They had been receptionists, shoopkeepers, or a staff nurse. 2 had retired. Of the 77 who are employed, 9 are self-employed and 28 have always had the same job. These include RAF workers, beauty consultant, engineer ,sales representative, police, teacher and chauffeur. 35 work in an office, 18 in a factory and only one on a farm. At one time the steelworks employed 13,500 people . Since these j0bs went new jobs are being created at the Industrial Estates.In spite of Clwyd being an enterprise zone it is very difficult to attract jobs at the present.
